items.title: Edge function 401 Unauthorized - missing config.toml with verify_jwt = false
items.description: Raycast extension getting HTTP 401 Unauthorized when calling edge functions (/functions/v1/projects, /functions/v1/meta, /functions/v1/docs). Root cause: No supabase/config.toml existed, so Supabase defaulted to verify_jwt = true for all edge functions. The Raycast extension sends no Authorization header because these are public read-only endpoints (per ADR-008). Fix: Created config.toml via supabase init and added [functions.<name>] verify_jwt = false for all three functions. Restarted local Supabase to apply.

items.title: Edge functions query legacy projects table instead of current_projects view
items.description: Raycast extension getting 400 errors when fetching projects via /rest/v1/projects. Root cause: Schema changed to snapshot-based runs (migration 20260121000000) - data now in run_projects table exposed via current_projects view, but edge functions still query legacy projects table. PostgREST also requires API key which is poor UX. Fix: Update edge functions to query current_projects view. Raycast should use /functions/v1/projects endpoint (no API key required).

items.title: Deleted projects persist in storage after deletion from ChatGPT
items.description: Projects deleted from ChatGPT are never removed from storage. The system is 'additive only' - it upserts projects but never deletes them. After consolidating duplicates in ChatGPT, old entries remain in the project list. P0 bug - defeats the core purpose of the indexer. Fix: After a successful scan that enumerates all projects, compare seen IDs against stored IDs and remove any not seen.

items.title: Auth detection takes 30-60+ seconds when already logged in
items.description: The `auth login` command takes 30-60+ seconds to complete even when the user is already authenticated. Root cause: Sequential selector checking with 15s timeout per selector (4 selectors = 60s worst case). The actual matching selector is the 3rd one. Fix: Use Promise.race() for parallel selector checking, reorder selectors by match probability, reduce timeout to 3s. Result: Detection now takes ~1.3s instead of 30-60s.

items.title: Failed runs don't sync projects to Supabase - data loss
items.description: When runs fail (auth timeout, browser crash, network error), projects extracted during that run are saved to local JSON but not synced to Supabase. Root cause: Local JSON writer flushes immediately during extraction, but Supabase writer buffers and flushes periodically. If the run fails before a flush, the buffer is lost. Evidence: 524 of 703 runs (75%) have failed status. 10 projects exist in local JSON but not in Supabase. Steps to reproduce: 1) Start indexer in watch mode, 2) Let it extract some projects, 3) Kill the process before flush interval (5s), 4) Compare local JSON count vs Supabase count. Expected: All extracted projects in Supabase. Actual: Projects missing from Supabase.

items.title: Add verbose debug mode for development iteration
items.description: Add detailed logging output when running with -v/--verbose flag. Shows scrolling progress, project extraction details, selector attempts, and timing information. Leverages existing logger infrastructure with DEBUG level. Helps developers understand what the indexer is doing during active iteration.

items.title: Add npm helper scripts for authentication commands
items.description: Add npm scripts for frequently used authentication commands: auth:login, auth:status, auth:export. Uses tsx for development-friendly execution without requiring a build step.

items.title: Authentication timeout silent failures - no external notification
items.description: Watch mode fails silently with authentication timeouts. System logs warnings and retries but user has no visibility without watching logs. Requires SMS notification on first auth failure, with auto-recovery attempt (page refresh) before alerting. Related to E-008 notifications epic.

items.title: Touch queue race condition with scan navigation
items.description: Touch queue processing fails with 'Execution context was destroyed' and subsequent 403 errors. Root cause: race condition where touch queue starts polling immediately after browser launch, but runSingleScan() navigates the page which destroys the execution context of in-progress page.evaluate() calls. Fix: start/resume touch queue AFTER scan completes instead of before.

items.title: Hot reload for watch mode
items.description: Explore whether hot reloading can be supported when the indexer runs in watch mode. When iterating on code, the process should automatically pick up changes without manual restarts. This reduces friction during development.

items.title: Touch API and OpenAPI documentation
items.description: Expose touch functionality via REST API so Raycast extension can trigger touch operations to float projects to top of ChatGPT sidebar. Uses queue-based pattern: POST to touch_queue table via PostgREST, indexer watch mode polls and processes. Also adds OpenAPI/Swagger documentation for all API endpoints.

items.title: Missing @supabase/supabase-js dependency
items.description: Application fails to start with ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND for @supabase/supabase-js. The package is imported in src/storage/supabase.ts but not listed in package.json dependencies. Steps to reproduce: npm start. Root cause: dependency was never added when Supabase backend was implemented.

items.title: Add unit test framework and core tests
items.description: Set up vitest (recommended for ESM/TypeScript) and create unit tests for core modules: storage/writer.ts (data persistence logic), auth/detector.ts (authentication state detection), utils/interval-parser.ts (interval string parsing). No test framework currently configured.

items.title: Add integration tests for multi-module workflows
items.description: Create integration tests covering: storage backend fallback (Supabase unavailable → local JSON continues), run lifecycle (start → project extraction → complete with stats), pin/touch workflow end-to-end.

items.title: Add E2E tests for browser automation workflows
items.description: Add Playwright e2e tests using test fixtures for: auth flow validation, sidebar navigation and project enumeration, watch mode timer behavior. Playwright is already a dependency.

items.title: Migrate console.log calls to structured logger
items.description: 78 instances of console.log/error/warn across source files. The project has a structured logger (src/utils/logger.ts) that is underutilized. Migrate console.log calls to use log levels appropriately (debug for verbose, info for operations, warn/error for issues).

items.title: Restrict CORS origins in Supabase edge functions
items.description: Edge functions use Access-Control-Allow-Origin: "*" allowing any origin. For production deployment, restrict CORS to specific origins or use Supabase authentication to protect endpoints. Located in: supabase/functions/projects/index.ts, supabase/functions/meta/index.ts

items.title: Document Supabase demo key as local-only default
items.description: The local Supabase demo anon key is hardcoded as a fallback in src/config/constants.ts:75 and README.md:243. While this is the standard local development key, document clearly that production deployments must set SUPABASE_ANON_KEY environment variable.

items.title: Review RLS policies for production Supabase deployment
items.description: The runs table RLS policy allows anon role full access (using (true) with check (true)). Acceptable for local-only usage but not for public deployment. Implement proper RLS policies based on authenticated users or service role. Located in: supabase/migrations/20251230142808_add_run_tracking.sql:29-32

items.title: Add GitHub Actions CI pipeline
items.description: No CI/CD configuration found (.github/workflows/ missing). Add a basic CI workflow that runs: npm run typecheck, npm run build, and tests (once added). This will prevent regressions on pull requests.

items.title: Watch mode for continuous enumeration
items.description: Add --watch flag to run command for continuous operation. Re-scans every 15 minutes (configurable via --interval). Includes delta detection to report new vs unchanged projects, structured timestamped logging for journalctl/tail, and graceful shutdown on SIGTERM/SIGINT. Does not crash on errors - logs and retries on next interval.

items.title: CLI auth subcommand for headless/remote authentication
items.description: Add `auth` CLI commands for portable session management: `auth login` (opens browser, exports session + populates persistent context), `auth export` (export from existing session), `auth import <file>` (import session for headless use with validation and permission warnings), `auth status` (check validity). Update `run` command to check auth status before starting. Uses Playwright's storageState() for portable JSON session files.

items.title: Bug: Project titles extracted as lowercase slug instead of proper title
items.description: Project titles are captured as lowercase with spaces (e.g., 'sunrise fuel captionsai') instead of proper casing with delimiters (e.g., 'Sunrise Fuel :: CaptionsAI'). Root cause: extractProjectsFromPopup() falls back to URL slug parsing when innerText extraction fails, but doesn't check the title attribute which contains the full proper-cased title. This violates PRD requirements DP-04 (full-fidelity capture) and success criteria (full titles match tooltip-expanded text).

items.title: E-001: Browser automation bootstrap
items.description: Set up browser automation infrastructure using a real browser session. The system should attempt headless mode first, then fall back to headful automatically. Browser session must support unattended operation and backgrounding.

items.title: E-002: Authentication detection and recovery
items.description: Detect authentication state on ChatGPT Web. Identify credential degradation early and notify user. On credential expiration, pause enumeration, notify user, foreground browser for re-authentication, then resume after login.

items.title: E-003: Projects menu navigation
items.description: Navigate to and open the Projects sidebar menu on ChatGPT Web. The menu is behind a 'See more' expansion that reveals an infinite-scroll list with tooltip titles.

items.title: E-004: Infinite scroll exhaustion
items.description: Scroll the Projects menu until all Projects are loaded. Handle the auto-dismiss behavior of the menu by maintaining hover. Continue scrolling patiently until no new Projects appear.

items.title: E-005: Hover-based inspection
items.description: Hover each Project entry to reveal full titles via tooltip. Capture Project identifiers without clicking. A Project is considered discovered only when its identifier and full title are resolved via hover.

items.title: E-006: Progress tracking and resume
items.description: Track enumeration progress and support resume after interruption. Re-processing is acceptable but missing data is not. Multiple passes must not corrupt or duplicate logical records (idempotent extraction).

items.title: E-007: Long-running process management
items.description: Support long-running, unattended operation. Handle controlled shutdown with safe restart capability. Support idle steady state when not actively scraping.

items.title: E-008: Notification and alerting
items.description: Provide notifications via macOS notifications, terminal alerts, and optional sound. Surface status, progress, warnings, and errors through CLI output.

items.title: US-001: Initial startup and enumeration
items.description:
As a user, I want to start the indexer once and have it begin enumerating all my Projects automatically, writing results incrementally to persistent storage.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given the indexer is started, When connected to ChatGPT, Then enumeration begins automatically
- Given enumeration is in progress, When Projects are discovered, Then they are written incrementally to storage
- Given the browser session, When startup occurs, Then attempt headless first with headful fallback

items.title: US-002: Background enumeration
items.description:
As a user, I want the process to run unattended in the background, patiently scrolling and hovering until all Projects are exhausted.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given the process is running, When enumeration is active, Then it continues without user intervention
- Given the Projects menu, When scrolling reaches the end, Then enumeration completes
- Given the menu auto-dismiss behavior, When hovering, Then the menu remains open

items.title: US-003: Credential degradation warning
items.description:
As a user, I want to be notified early when credentials may be expiring so I can re-authenticate before enumeration is interrupted.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given authentication state is monitored, When degradation is detected, Then user is notified
- Given a warning is issued, When user receives it, Then they have time to act before expiration

items.title: US-004: Credential expiration recovery
items.description:
As a user, I want the system to pause on credential expiration, notify me, foreground the browser for login, and resume automatically after I authenticate.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given credentials expire, When detected, Then enumeration pauses
- Given enumeration is paused, When notified, Then browser is foregrounded
- Given user logs in, When session is restored, Then enumeration resumes automatically

items.title: US-005: Hover for full title capture
items.description:
As a user, I want each Project's full title captured via hover tooltip, not the truncated sidebar text.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a Project entry, When hovered, Then tooltip with full title appears
- Given the tooltip, When visible, Then full title is captured
- Given truncated display text, When compared to tooltip, Then tooltip takes precedence

items.title: US-006: Project identifier capture
items.description:
As a user, I want Project identifiers captured so I can generate deep links that work on mobile and other platforms.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a Project entry, When inspected, Then stable identifier is extracted
- Given the identifier, When used in a URL, Then it opens the correct Project
- Given capture occurs, When no clicking happens, Then the process remains read-only

items.title: US-007: Idempotent re-enumeration
items.description:
As a user, I want multiple passes to not corrupt or duplicate my Project records.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a Project was previously captured, When re-encountered, Then it updates confirmation timestamp
- Given duplicate detection, When same identifier found, Then no duplicate record created
- Given title changed, When re-encountered, Then title is updated

items.title: US-008: Graceful shutdown
items.description:
As a user, I want to stop the process gracefully and restart later without losing progress.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given shutdown signal, When received, Then process stops cleanly
- Given partial progress, When stopped, Then state is persisted
- Given restart, When resumed, Then progress is maintained

items.title: US-009: Idle steady state
items.description:
As a user, I want the process to remain running in an idle state after enumeration completes.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given enumeration complete, When idle, Then process remains running
- Given idle state, When monitoring, Then no active scraping occurs
- Given idle state, When triggered, Then can resume operations

items.title: US-010: CLI status output
items.description:
As a user, I want clear status, progress, warnings, and errors displayed in the terminal.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given enumeration progress, When updated, Then CLI shows current count
- Given warnings occur, When detected, Then CLI displays warning message
- Given errors occur, When detected, Then CLI displays error with context

items.title: US-011: macOS notifications
items.description:
As a user, I want to receive macOS notifications for important events like auth expiration and enumeration completion.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given auth expiration, When detected, Then macOS notification sent
- Given enumeration complete, When finished, Then notification sent
- Given notification sent, When user interaction required, Then notification is actionable

items.title: US-012: Persistent storage output
items.description:
As a user, I want enumerated Projects written to persistent storage so I can query them outside the ChatGPT UI.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a Project discovered, When captured, Then written to storage
- Given storage format, When designed, Then decoupled from consumption (storage-agnostic)
- Given captured data, When stored, Then includes identifier, full title, first seen, and last confirmed timestamps
